description: Build complex, responsive layouts easily with Flexbox and CSS Grid.

slides.title: Flexbox Basics
slides.content:
# Flexbox ğŸ’ª

Designed for 1D layouts (rows OR columns). Put items in a container.

```css
.container {
  display: flex;
}
```

## Flex Direction

```css
flex-direction: row; /* Default: Left to Right */
flex-direction: column; /* Top to Bottom */
```

slides.title: Flex Justify and Align
slides.content:
# Flex Alignment ğŸ“

## Justify Content (Main Axis)
Suppose `row` direction:
```css
justify-content: center; /* Center horizontally */
justify-content: space-between; /* Equal space between */
justify-content: flex-end; /* Right align */
```

## Align Items (Cross Axis)
```css
align-items: center; /* Center vertically */
align-items: stretch; /* Stretch to fill height */
```

> ğŸ¯ **Tip:** `display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center;` is the easiest way to perfectly center something!

slides.title: CSS Grid Basics
Summary
slides.content:
# Layout Mastery ğŸ—ï¸

## Flexbox
- Best for components, navbars, 1D lists.
- `justify-content` & `align-items` control alignment.

## Grid
- Best for overall page structure, galleries, 2D layouts.
- `grid-template-columns` defines the structure.
